{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3563296,"name":"Yahya Burak","username":"FRC-ITOBOT","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frc-itobot/{size}/248565_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T20:01:02.927Z","cooked":"

We have Neo v1.1 motors that we use with Sparkmax and Cancoder. They are in the Swerve MK4i chassis and we are thinking of switching to Kraken X60 motors in the near future. Is there any incompatibility or inconsistency like the Neos? I would like to get advice from those who use them or have suggestions. Or what should ı do when ı get the motors

FRC-ITOBOT:

Is there any incompatibility or inconsistency like the Neos?

According to my experience there should be no problem. Last year we used YAGSL with neos and we didn’t struggle from inconsistency.

image704×58 7.63 KB

This year we used tuner x swerve generator(I think it is harder than YAGSL). If you have full ctre swerve I think it offers better odometry. But I still think the easiest way is YAGSL

This commit should have been split up, but if you ignore everything in the “StateMachine.java” this is all we needed to do to swtich from Neo to Krakens. You change the motor controller type in the config, you update the CAN ID’s and assuming the gear ratio is the same (L3 stays L3 or L2 stays L2) YAGSL makes it as easy as this!

updated swrve motors · FRC-Team-8513-Sisters-1st/2025-RobotCode@400c3f1

Could you describe specific pain points you had with Swerve Generator?

Thanks!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-22T12:07:22.707Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":22.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496370,"topic_slug":"i-will-switch-from-neo-v1-1-to-kraken-x60-in-yagsl-how-do-i-do-it","display_username":"Dalton","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64968,"username":"DukeEmree","name":"Emre ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61981,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/i-will-switch-from-neo-v1-1-to-kraken-x60-in-yagsl-how-do-i-do-it/496370/6","custom_user_title":"CTR Electronics","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3565334,"name":"Emre ","username":"DukeEmree","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-22T12:56:16.037Z","cooked":"

Tunerconstants is written in java, but in decimal numbers commas are used instead of dots (I tried with different computers). And some commas were completely in the wrong place (our drivetrain length was million inches). I think the wheel radius was 20 inches when it should have been 2 inches, either because tunerconstans gave it wrong or we put it in the wrong place while correcting it. I also observed that other teams who used it for the first time left the max speed value and other values that need to be adjusted as default and did not know how to adjust them completely. I think the documentation needs to be more detailed and guiding in this regard. I think the Yagsl documentation is more detailed.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-22T12:57:26.270Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":24.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496370,"topic_slug":"i-will-switch-from-neo-v1-1-to-kraken-x60-in-yagsl-how-do-i-do-it","display_username":"Emre ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":61981,"username":"daltzsmith","name":"Dalton","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltzsmith/{size}/206287_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/i-will-switch-from-neo-v1-1-to-kraken-x60-in-yagsl-how-do-i-do-it/496370/7","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3565347,"name":"Dalton","username":"daltzsmith","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltzsmith/{size}/206287_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-22T13:37:16.943Z","cooked":"

but in decimal numbers commas are used instead of dots

Nobody has reported this yet, but is it possible on the computers you tried that the are configured to a foreign language that uses commas instead of periods for decimals (French does this iirc).

If that’s the case, this is a bug and we’ll look into fixing it.

I think the wheel radius was 20 inches when it should have been 2 inches, either because tunerconstans gave it wrong or we put it in the wrong place while correcting it.

I haven’t heard of any issue related to this, so not sure if this is user error here.

think the documentation needs to be more detailed and guiding in this regard

I agree on the documentation improvements. There are lots of things we should add to the documentation as well (customizing swerve requests, better localization docs, etc).

Note that everything should be functional out of the box with no manual modification necessary. Tuning should be done to improve odometry accuracy, reduce wheel slip, etc (which is why you should still tune your steer gains).

Regardless, thank you for the detailed feedback and don’t hesitate to reach out to us (email, phone number, etc) for any help with our software.

daltzsmith:

Nobody has reported this yet, but is it possible on the computers you tried that the are configured to a foreign language that uses commas instead of periods for decimals (French does this iirc).

If that’s the case, this is a bug and we’ll look into fixing it.

Yes we are using turkish keyboards. Thanks for your attention.

(FTC)","slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","posts_count":14,"reply_count":10,"highest_post_number":14,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2025-04-28T00:42:28.472Z","last_posted_at":"2025-04-28T18:50:43.322Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-04-28T18:50:43.322Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"I
